module.name: dimension_tolerance
module.keywords: module dimension, tolerance, angular, location, linear, plus, minus, limit, fit
module.purpose: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of geometric dimensions of a shape and the direct application of tolerances to geometric dimensions.

inscope.li: specification of geometric dimensions of a feature of a shape;
specification of the value of a dimension;
specification of tolerances for geometric dimensions;
plus and minus tolerances applied to dimensions;

uof.name: Dimension_Tolerance
uof.description: The Dimension_Tolerance UoF specifies the data constructs needed to specify dimensions of size and location of features and to appy direct tolerances to those dimensions.

alt_map.refpath: angular_location <= dimensional_location <= shape_aspect_relationship (shape_aspect_relationship.related_shape_aspect -> shape_aspect)

angular_location <= dimensional_location <= shape_aspect_relationship (shape_aspect_relationship.related_shape_aspect -> shape_aspect <- {shape_aspect => derived_shape_aspect => extension} shape_aspect_relationship.relating_shape_aspect shape_aspect_relationship => {shape_aspect_relationship.name = 'mirroring relationship'} shape_aspect_deriving_relationship)
angular_location <= dimensional_location <= shape_aspect_relationship (shape_aspect_relationship.related_shape_aspect -> shape_aspect)

(angular_location <= dimensional_location <= shape_aspect_relationship shape_aspect_relationship.related_shape_aspect -> shape_aspect <- {shape_aspect => derived_shape_aspect => perpendicular_to} shape_aspect_relationship.relating_shape_aspect shape_aspect_relationship => {shape_aspect_relationship.name = 'positive normal relationship'} shape_aspect_deriving_relationship)

(angular_location <= dimensional_location <= shape_aspect_relationship shape_aspect_relationship.related_shape_aspect -> shape_aspect <- {shape_aspect => derived_shape_aspect => perpendicular_to} shape_aspect_relationship.relating_shape_aspect shape_aspect_relationship => {shape_aspect_relationship.name = 'negative normal relationship'} shape_aspect_deriving_relationship)

(angular_location <= dimensional_location <= shape_aspect_relationship shape_aspect_relationship.related_shape_aspect -> shape_aspect <- {shape_aspect => derived_shape_aspect => extension} shape_aspect_relationship.relating_shape_aspect shape_aspect_relationship => {shape_aspect_relationship.name = 'mirroring relationship'} shape_aspect_deriving_relationship)

plus_minus_tolerance plus_minus_tolerance.range -> tolerance_method_definition tolerance_method_definition = tolerance_value tolerance_value

plus_minus_tolerance classification_item = plus_minus_tolerance classification_item <- applied_classification_assignment.items[i] applied_classification_assignment <= classification_assignment {[classification_assignment.role -> classification_role classification_role.name = 'further tolerance requirements'] [classification_assignment.assigned_classification -> group {[group.name = 'E'] [group.description = 'dimensioning principle']}]}

alt_map.description: If it is an angular_location_dimension whose origin_determination is 'negative normal'

aa.refpath: [tolerance_value tolerance_value.lower_bound -> measure_with_unit <-] [tolerance_value tolerance_value.upper_bound -> measure_with_unit <-] measure_qualification.qualified_measure measure_qualification measure_qualification.qualifiers[i] -> value_qualifier value_qualifier = precision_qualifier precision_qualifier precision_qualifier.precision_value

tolerance_value [tolerance_value.lower_bound ->] [tolerance_value.upper_bound ->] measure_with_unit <- measure_qualification.qualified_measure measure_qualification measure_qualification.qualifiers[i] -> value_qualifier value_qualifier = type_qualifier type_qualifier type_qualifier.name {(type_qualifier.name) (type_qualifier.name = 'required') (type_qualifier.name = 'designed') (type_qualifier.name = 'calculated') (type_qualifier.name = 'measured') (type_qualifier.name = 'estimated'}
